userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/64.0.3282.140 Safari/537.36

is-on-https.name: is-on-https
is-on-https.helpText: All sites should be protected with HTTPS, even ones that don't handle sensitive data. HTTPS prevents intruders from tampering with or passively listening in on the communications between your app and your users, and is a prerequisite for HTTP/2 and many new web platform APIs. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/https).

redirects-http.name: redirects-http
redirects-http.description: Does not redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS
redirects-http.helpText: If you've already set up HTTPS, make sure that you redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/http-redirects-to-https).

service-worker.name: service-worker
service-worker.description: Does not register a service worker
service-worker.helpText: The service worker is the technology that enables your app to use many Progressive Web App features, such as offline, add to homescreen, and push notifications. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/registered-service-worker).

works-offline.name: works-offline
works-offline.description: Does not respond with a 200 when offline
works-offline.helpText: If you're building a Progressive Web App, consider using a service worker so that your app can work offline. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/http-200-when-offline).

viewport.name: viewport
viewport.description: Has a `<meta name="viewport">` tag with `width` or `initial-scale`
viewport.helpText: Add a viewport meta tag to optimize your app for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/has-viewport-meta-tag).

without-javascript.name: without-javascript
without-javascript.description: Contains some content when JavaScript is not available
without-javascript.helpText: Your app should display some content when JavaScript is disabled, even if it's just a warning to the user that JavaScript is required to use the app. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/no-js).

first-meaningful-paint.name: first-meaningful-paint
first-meaningful-paint.helpText: First meaningful paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/first-meaningful-paint).

load-fast-enough-for-pwa.name: load-fast-enough-for-pwa
load-fast-enough-for-pwa.description: Page load is fast enough on 3G
load-fast-enough-for-pwa.helpText: A fast page load over a 3G network ensures a good mobile user experience. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/fast-3g).

speed-index-metric.name: speed-index-metric
speed-index-metric.helpText: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/speed-index).

screenshot-thumbnails.name: screenshot-thumbnails
screenshot-thumbnails.helpText: This is what the load of your site looked like.

estimated-input-latency.name: estimated-input-latency
estimated-input-latency.helpText: The score above is an estimate of how long your app takes to respond to user input, in milliseconds. There is a 90% probability that a user encounters this amount of latency, or less. 10% of the time a user can expect additional latency. If your latency is higher than 50 ms, users may perceive your app as laggy. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/estimated-input-latency).

errors-in-console.name: errors-in-console
errors-in-console.description: No browser errors logged to the console
errors-in-console.helpText: Errors logged to the console indicate unresolved problems. They can come from network request failures and other browser concerns.

time-to-first-byte.name: time-to-first-byte
time-to-first-byte.helpText: Time To First Byte identifies the time at which your server sends a response. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/network-performance/issues).

first-interactive.name: first-interactive
first-interactive.helpText: First Interactive marks the time at which the page is minimally interactive. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/first-interactive).

consistently-interactive.name: consistently-interactive
consistently-interactive.helpText: Consistently Interactive marks the time at which the page is fully interactive. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/consistently-interactive).

user-timings.name: user-timings
user-timings.helpText: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to create custom, real-world measurements of key user experiences. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/user-timing).

critical-request-chains.name: critical-request-chains
critical-request-chains.helpText: The Critical Request Chains below show you what resources are issued with a high priority. Consider reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/critical-request-chains).

redirects.name: redirects
redirects.helpText: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/AvoidRedirects).

webapp-install-banner.debugString: Failures: No manifest was fetched, Site does not register a service worker, Service worker does not successfully serve the manifest's start_url.

warnings: No usable web app manifest found on page http://127.0.0.1:8887/
failures: Site does not register a service worker
Service worker does not successfully serve the manifest's start_url

webapp-install-banner.name: webapp-install-banner
webapp-install-banner.description: User will not be prompted to Install the Web App
webapp-install-banner.helpText: Browsers can proactively prompt users to add your app to their homescreen, which can lead to higher engagement. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/install-prompt).

splash-screen.name: splash-screen
splash-screen.description: Is not configured for a custom splash screen
splash-screen.helpText: A themed splash screen ensures a high-quality experience when users launch your app from their homescreens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/custom-splash-screen).

themed-omnibox.debugString: Failures: No manifest was fetched, No `<meta name="theme-color">` tag found.
themed-omnibox.name: themed-omnibox
themed-omnibox.description: Address bar does not match brand colors
themed-omnibox.helpText: The browser address bar can be themed to match your site. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/address-bar).

manifest-short-name-length.name: manifest-short-name-length
manifest-short-name-length.description: Manifest's `short_name` will be truncated when displayed on homescreen
manifest-short-name-length.helpText: Make your app's `short_name` fewer than 12 characters to ensure that it's not truncated on homescreens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/manifest-short_name-is-not-truncated).

content-width.name: content-width
content-width.description: Content is sized correctly for the viewport
content-width.helpText: If the width of your app's content doesn't match the width of the viewport, your app might not be optimized for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/content-sized-correctly-for-viewport).

image-aspect-ratio.name: image-aspect-ratio
image-aspect-ratio.description: Displays images with correct aspect ratio
image-aspect-ratio.helpText: Image display dimensions should match natural aspect ratio.

deprecations.name: deprecations
deprecations.helpText: Deprecated APIs will eventually be removed from the browser. [Learn more](https://www.chromestatus.com/features#deprecated).

mainthread-work-breakdown.name: mainthread-work-breakdown
mainthread-work-breakdown.helpText: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS.You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this.

bootup-time.name: bootup-time
bootup-time.helpText: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this.

pwa-cross-browser.name: pwa-cross-browser
pwa-cross-browser.helpText: To reach the most number of users, sites should work across every major browser. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist#site-works-cross-browser).

pwa-page-transitions.name: pwa-page-transitions
pwa-page-transitions.description: Page transitions don't feel like they block on the network
pwa-page-transitions.helpText: Transitions should feel snappy as you tap around, even on a slow network, a key to perceived performance. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist#page-transitions-dont-feel-like-they-block-on-the-network).

pwa-each-page-has-url.name: pwa-each-page-has-url
pwa-each-page-has-url.helpText: Ensure individual pages are deep linkable via the URLs and that URLs are unique for the purpose of shareability on social media. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist#each-page-has-a-url).

accesskeys.name: accesskeys
accesskeys.helpText: Access keys let users quickly focus a part of the page. For proper navigation, each access key must be unique. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/accesskeys?application=lighthouse).

aria-allowed-attr.name: aria-allowed-attr
aria-allowed-attr.helpText: Each ARIA `role` supports a specific subset of `aria-*` attributes. Mismatching these invalidates the `aria-*` attributes. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-allowed-attr?application=lighthouse).

aria-required-attr.name: aria-required-attr
aria-required-attr.description: `[role]`s do not have all required `[aria-*]` attributes
aria-required-attr.helpText: Some ARIA roles have required attributes that describe the state of the element to screen readers. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-required-attr?application=lighthouse).

aria-required-children.name: aria-required-children
aria-required-children.description: Elements with `[role]` that require specific children `[role]`s, are missing.
aria-required-children.helpText: Some ARIA parent roles must contain specific child roles to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-required-children?application=lighthouse).

aria-required-parent.name: aria-required-parent
aria-required-parent.description: `[role]`s are not contained by their required parent element
aria-required-parent.helpText: Some ARIA child roles must be contained by specific parent roles to properly perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-required-parent?application=lighthouse).

aria-roles.name: aria-roles
aria-roles.helpText: ARIA roles must have valid values in order to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-roles?application=lighthouse).

aria-valid-attr-value.name: aria-valid-attr-value
aria-valid-attr-value.helpText: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid values. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-valid-attr-value?application=lighthouse).

aria-valid-attr.name: aria-valid-attr
aria-valid-attr.description: `[aria-*]` attributes are valid and not misspelled
aria-valid-attr.helpText: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid names. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-valid-attr?application=lighthouse).

audio-caption.name: audio-caption
audio-caption.description: `<audio>` elements are missing a `<track>` element with `[kind="captions"]`.
audio-caption.helpText: Captions make audio elements usable for deaf or hearing-impaired users, providing critical information such as who is talking, what they're saying, and other non-speech information. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/audio-caption?application=lighthouse).

button-name.name: button-name
button-name.helpText: When a button doesn't have an accessible name, screen readers announce it as "button", making it unusable for users who rely on screen readers. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/button-name?application=lighthouse).

bypass.name: bypass
bypass.description: The page does not contain a heading, skip link, or landmark region
bypass.helpText: Adding ways to bypass repetitive content lets keyboard users navigate the page more efficiently. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/bypass?application=lighthouse).

color-contrast.name: color-contrast
color-contrast.description: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
color-contrast.helpText: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/color-contrast?application=lighthouse).

definition-list.name: definition-list
definition-list.description: `<dl>`'s do not contain only properly-ordered `<dt>` and `<dd>` groups, `<script>` or `<template>` elements.
definition-list.helpText: When definition lists are not properly marked up, screen readers may produce confusing or inaccurate output. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/definition-list?application=lighthouse).

dlitem.name: dlitem
dlitem.description: Definition list items are not wrapped in `<dl>` elements
dlitem.helpText: Definition list items (`<dt>` and `<dd>`) must be wrapped in a parent `<dl>` element to ensure that screen readers can properly announce them. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/dlitem?application=lighthouse).

document-title.name: document-title
document-title.helpText: Screen reader users use page titles to get an overview of the contents of the page. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/document-title?application=lighthouse).

duplicate-id.name: duplicate-id
duplicate-id.description: `[id]` attributes on the page are unique
duplicate-id.helpText: The value of an id attribute must be unique to prevent other instances from being overlooked by assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/duplicate-id?application=lighthouse).

frame-title.name: frame-title
frame-title.description: `<frame>` or `<iframe>` elements do not have a title
frame-title.helpText: Screen reader users rely on frame titles to describe the contents of frames. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/frame-title?application=lighthouse).

value.description: Ensures every HTML document has a lang attribute
value.help: <html> element must have a lang attribute

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute
target: html

html-has-lang.name: html-has-lang
html-has-lang.description: `<html>` element does not have a `[lang]` attribute
html-has-lang.helpText: If a page doesn't specify a lang attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader. If the page isn't actually in the default language, then the screen reader might not announce the page's text correctly. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/html-lang?application=lighthouse).

items.selector: html

html-lang-valid.name: html-lang-valid
html-lang-valid.description: `<html>` element does not have a valid value for its `[lang]` attribute.
html-lang-valid.helpText: Specifying a valid [BCP 47 language](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-choosing-language-tags#question) helps screen readers announce text properly. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/valid-lang?application=lighthouse).

image-alt.name: image-alt
image-alt.description: Image elements do not have `[alt]` attributes
image-alt.helpText: Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute.[Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/image-alt?application=lighthouse).

input-image-alt.name: input-image-alt
input-image-alt.description: `<input type="image">` elements do not have `[alt]` text
input-image-alt.helpText: When an image is being used as an `<input>` button, providing alternative text can help screen reader users understand the purpose of the button. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/input-image-alt?application=lighthouse).

value.description: Ensures every form element has a label

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty or not visible
  Form element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Form element does not have an explicit <label>
  Element has no title attribute or the title attribute is empty
target: #selectCityToAdd

label.name: label
label.description: Form elements do not have associated labels
label.helpText: Labels ensure that form controls are announced properly by assistive technologies, like screen readers. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/label?application=lighthouse).

items.selector: #selectCityToAdd

layout-table.name: layout-table
layout-table.description: Presentational `<table>` elements do not avoid using `<th>`, `<caption>` or the `[summary]` attribute.
layout-table.helpText: A table being used for layout purposes should not include data elements, such as the th or caption elements or the summary attribute, because this can create a confusing experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/layout-table?application=lighthouse).

link-name.name: link-name
link-name.description: Links do not have a discernable name
link-name.helpText: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/link-name?application=lighthouse).

list.name: list
list.description: Lists do not contain only `<li>` elements and script supporting elements (`<script>` and `<template>`).
list.helpText: Screen readers have a specific way of announcing lists. Ensuring proper list structure aids screen reader output. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/list?application=lighthouse).

listitem.name: listitem
listitem.description: List items (`<li>`) are not contained within `<ul>` or `<ol>` parent elements.
listitem.helpText: Screen readers require list items (`<li>`) to be contained within a parent `<ul>` or `<ol>` to be announced properly. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/listitem?application=lighthouse).

meta-refresh.name: meta-refresh
meta-refresh.helpText: Users do not expect a page to refresh automatically, and doing so will move focus back to the top of the page. This may create a frustrating or confusing experience. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/meta-refresh?application=lighthouse).

meta-viewport.name: meta-viewport
meta-viewport.description: `[user-scalable="no"]` is not used in the `<meta name="viewport">` element and the `[maximum-scale]` attribute is not less than 5.
meta-viewport.helpText: Disabling zooming is problematic for users with low vision who rely on screen magnification to properly see the contents of a web page. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/meta-viewport?application=lighthouse).

object-alt.name: object-alt
object-alt.helpText: Screen readers cannot translate non-text content. Adding alt text to `<object>` elements helps screen readers convey meaning to users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/object-alt?application=lighthouse).

tabindex.name: tabindex
tabindex.description: Some elements have a `[tabindex]` value greater than 0
tabindex.helpText: A value greater than 0 implies an explicit navigation ordering. Although technically valid, this often creates frustrating experiences for users who rely on assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/tabindex?application=lighthouse).

td-headers-attr.name: td-headers-attr
td-headers-attr.description: Cells in a `<table>` element that use the `[headers]` attribute refers to other cells of that same table.
td-headers-attr.helpText: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring `<td>` cells using the `[headers]` attribute only refer to other cells in the same table may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/td-headers-attr?application=lighthouse).

th-has-data-cells.name: th-has-data-cells
th-has-data-cells.description: `<th>` elements and elements with `[role="columnheader"/"rowheader"]` do not have data cells they describe.
th-has-data-cells.helpText: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring table headers always refer to some set of cells may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/th-has-data-cells?application=lighthouse).

valid-lang.name: valid-lang
valid-lang.description: `[lang]` attributes do not have a valid value
valid-lang.helpText: Specifying a valid [BCP 47 language](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-choosing-language-tags#question) on elements helps ensure that text is pronounced correctly by a screen reader. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/valid-lang?application=lighthouse).

video-caption.name: video-caption
video-caption.description: `<video>` elements do not contain a `<track>` element with `[kind="captions"]`.
video-caption.helpText: When a video provides a caption it is easier for deaf and hearing impaired users to access its information. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/video-caption?application=lighthouse).

video-description.name: video-description
video-description.description: `<video>` elements do not contain a `<track>` element with `[kind="description"]`.
video-description.helpText: Audio descriptions provide relevant information for videos that dialogue cannot, such as facial expressions and scenes. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/video-description?application=lighthouse).

custom-controls-labels.name: custom-controls-labels
custom-controls-labels.helpText: Custom interactive controls have associated labels, provided by aria-label or aria-labelledby. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#try_it_with_a_screen_reader).

custom-controls-roles.name: custom-controls-roles
custom-controls-roles.helpText: Custom interactive controls have appropriate ARIA roles. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#try_it_with_a_screen_reader).

focus-traps.name: focus-traps
focus-traps.description: User focus is not accidentally trapped in a region
focus-traps.helpText: A user can tab into and out of any control or region without accidentally trapping their focus. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#start_with_the_keyboard).

focusable-controls.name: focusable-controls
focusable-controls.helpText: Custom interactive controls are keyboard focusable and display a focus indicator. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#start_with_the_keyboard).

heading-levels.name: heading-levels
heading-levels.helpText: Headings are used to create an outline for the page and heading levels are not skipped. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#take_advantage_of_headings_and_landmarks).

logical-tab-order.name: logical-tab-order
logical-tab-order.description: The page has a logical tab order
logical-tab-order.helpText: Tabbing through the page follows the visual layout. Users cannot focus elements that are offscreen. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#start_with_the_keyboard).

managed-focus.name: managed-focus
managed-focus.description: The user's focus is directed to new content added to the page
managed-focus.helpText: If new content, such as a dialog, is added to the page, the user's focus is directed to it. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#start_with_the_keyboard).

offscreen-content-hidden.name: offscreen-content-hidden
offscreen-content-hidden.description: Offscreen content is hidden from assistive technology
offscreen-content-hidden.helpText: Offscreen content is hidden with display: none or aria-hidden=true. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#try_it_with_a_screen_reader).

use-landmarks.name: use-landmarks
use-landmarks.description: HTML5 landmark elements are used to improve navigation
use-landmarks.helpText: Landmark elements (<main>, <nav>, etc.) are used to improve the keyboard navigation of the page for assistive technology. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#take_advantage_of_headings_and_landmarks).

visual-order-follows-dom.name: visual-order-follows-dom
visual-order-follows-dom.description: Visual order on the page follows DOM order
visual-order-follows-dom.helpText: DOM order matches the visual order, improving navigation for assistive technology. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#try_it_with_a_screen_reader).

uses-long-cache-ttl.name: uses-long-cache-ttl
uses-long-cache-ttl.description: Uses inefficient cache policy on static assets
uses-long-cache-ttl.helpText: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/http-caching#cache-control).

total-byte-weight.name: total-byte-weight
total-byte-weight.helpText: Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/network-payloads).

offscreen-images.name: offscreen-images
offscreen-images.helpText: Consider lazy-loading offscreen images to improve page load speed and time to interactive. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/offscreen-images).

unminified-css.name: unminified-css
unminified-css.helpText: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes.[Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/MinifyResources).

unminified-javascript.name: unminified-javascript
unminified-javascript.helpText: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time.[Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/MinifyResources).

unused-css-rules.name: unused-css-rules
unused-css-rules.helpText: Remove unused rules from stylesheets to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/OptimizeCSSDelivery)

uses-webp-images.name: uses-webp-images
uses-webp-images.helpText: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/webp).

uses-optimized-images.name: uses-optimized-images
uses-optimized-images.helpText: Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/optimize-images).

uses-request-compression.name: uses-request-compression
uses-request-compression.helpText: Text-based responses should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/optimize-encoding-and-transfer).

uses-responsive-images.name: uses-responsive-images
uses-responsive-images.helpText: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/oversized-images).

value.title: DOM Depth
value.snippet:
html >
  body >
    main.main >
      div.card.cardTemplate.weather-forecast >
        div.current >
          div.visual >
            div.temperature >
              span.value

dom-size.name: dom-size
dom-size.helpText: Browser engineers recommend pages contain fewer than ~1,500 DOM nodes. The sweet spot is a tree depth < 32 elements and fewer than 60 children/parent element. A large DOM can increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/).

items.title: DOM Depth
items.snippet:
html >
  body >
    main.main >
      div.card.cardTemplate.weather-forecast >
        div.current >
          div.visual >
            div.temperature >
              span.value

external-anchors-use-rel-noopener.name: external-anchors-use-rel-noopener
external-anchors-use-rel-noopener.helpText: Open new tabs using `rel="noopener"` to improve performance and prevent security vulnerabilities. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/noopener).

geolocation-on-start.name: geolocation-on-start
geolocation-on-start.description: Avoids requesting the geolocation permission on page load
geolocation-on-start.helpText: Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request their location without context. Consider tying the request to user gestures instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/geolocation-on-load).

link-blocking-first-paint.displayValue: 1 resource delayed first paint by 724 ms
link-blocking-first-paint.name: link-blocking-first-paint
link-blocking-first-paint.helpText: External stylesheets are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider delivering critical CSS via `<style>` tags and deferring non-critical styles. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/blocking-resources).

no-document-write.name: no-document-write
no-document-write.helpText: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/document-write).

no-mutation-events.name: no-mutation-events
no-mutation-events.description: Avoids Mutation Events in its own scripts
no-mutation-events.helpText: Mutation Events are deprecated and harm performance. Consider using Mutation Observers instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/mutation-events).

no-vulnerable-libraries.name: no-vulnerable-libraries
no-vulnerable-libraries.description: Avoids front-end JavaScript libraries with known security vulnerabilities
no-vulnerable-libraries.helpText: Some third-party scripts may contain known security vulnerabilities  that are easily identified and exploited by attackers.

no-websql.name: no-websql
no-websql.helpText: Web SQL is deprecated. Consider using IndexedDB instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/web-sql).

notification-on-start.name: notification-on-start
notification-on-start.description: Avoids requesting the notification permission on page load
notification-on-start.helpText: Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request to send notifications without context. Consider tying the request to user gestures instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/notifications-on-load).

password-inputs-can-be-pasted-into.name: password-inputs-can-be-pasted-into
password-inputs-can-be-pasted-into.description: Allows users to paste into password fields
password-inputs-can-be-pasted-into.helpText: Preventing password pasting undermines good security policy. [Learn more](https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/blog-post/let-them-paste-passwords)

header.text: Password inputs that prevent pasting into

script-blocking-first-paint.name: script-blocking-first-paint
script-blocking-first-paint.helpText: Script elements are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider inlining critical scripts and deferring non-critical ones. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/blocking-resources).

uses-http2.displayValue: 8 requests were not handled over HTTP/2
uses-http2.name: uses-http2
uses-http2.description: Does not use HTTP/2 for all of its resources
uses-http2.helpText: HTTP/2 offers many benefits over HTTP/1.1, including binary headers, multiplexing, and server push. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/http2).

uses-passive-event-listeners.name: uses-passive-event-listeners
uses-passive-event-listeners.description: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
uses-passive-event-listeners.helpText: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/passive-event-listeners).

meta-description.name: meta-description
meta-description.description: Document does not have a meta description
meta-description.helpText: Meta descriptions may be included in search results to concisely summarize page content. [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35624?hl=en#1).

http-status-code.name: http-status-code
http-status-code.description: Page has successful HTTP status code
http-status-code.helpText: Pages with unsuccessful HTTP status codes may not be indexed properly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/successful-http-code).

font-size.name: font-size
font-size.description: Document doesn't use legible font sizes
font-size.helpText: Font sizes less than 16px are too small to be legible and require mobile visitors to “pinch to zoom” in order to read. Strive to have >75% of page text ≥16px. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/UseLegibleFontSizes).

link-text.name: link-text
link-text.helpText: Descriptive link text helps search engines understand your content. [Learn more](https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2008/10/importance-of-link-architecture.html).

is-crawlable.name: is-crawlable
is-crawlable.helpText: The "Robots" directives tell crawlers how your content should be indexed. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/search/reference/robots_meta_tag).

hreflang.name: hreflang
hreflang.helpText: hreflang allows crawlers to discover alternate translations of the page content. [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/189077).

plugins.name: plugins
plugins.helpText: Most mobile devices do not support plugins, and many desktop browsers restrict them.

canonical.name: canonical
canonical.description: Document does not have a valid `rel=canonical`
canonical.helpText: Canonical links suggest which URL to show in search results. Read more in [Use canonical URLs](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/139066).

mobile-friendly.name: mobile-friendly
mobile-friendly.helpText: Take the [Mobile-Friendly Test](https://search.google.com/test/mobile-friendly) to see how easily a visitor can use your page on a mobile device. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/search/mobile-sites/).

structured-data.name: structured-data
structured-data.helpText: Run the [Structured Data Testing Tool](https://search.google.com/structured-data/testing-tool/) and the [Structured Data Linter](http://linter.structured-data.org/) to validate structured data. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/search/docs/guides/mark-up-content).

reportCategories.name: Performance
reportCategories.description: These encapsulate your web app's current performance and opportunities to improve it.

result.name: first-meaningful-paint
result.description: First meaningful paint
result.helpText: First meaningful paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/first-meaningful-paint).

result.name: first-interactive
result.description: First Interactive (beta)
result.helpText: First Interactive marks the time at which the page is minimally interactive. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/first-interactive).

result.name: consistently-interactive
result.description: Consistently Interactive (beta)
result.helpText: Consistently Interactive marks the time at which the page is fully interactive. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/consistently-interactive).

result.name: speed-index-metric
result.description: Perceptual Speed Index
result.helpText: Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/speed-index).

result.name: estimated-input-latency
result.description: Estimated Input Latency
result.helpText: The score above is an estimate of how long your app takes to respond to user input, in milliseconds. There is a 90% probability that a user encounters this amount of latency, or less. 10% of the time a user can expect additional latency. If your latency is higher than 50 ms, users may perceive your app as laggy. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/estimated-input-latency).

result.displayValue: 1 resource delayed first paint by 724 ms
result.name: link-blocking-first-paint
result.description: Reduce render-blocking stylesheets
result.helpText: External stylesheets are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider delivering critical CSS via `<style>` tags and deferring non-critical styles. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/blocking-resources).

result.name: script-blocking-first-paint
result.description: Reduce render-blocking scripts
result.helpText: Script elements are blocking the first paint of your page. Consider inlining critical scripts and deferring non-critical ones. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/blocking-resources).

result.name: uses-responsive-images
result.description: Properly size images
result.helpText: Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/oversized-images).

result.name: offscreen-images
result.description: Offscreen images
result.helpText: Consider lazy-loading offscreen images to improve page load speed and time to interactive. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/offscreen-images).

result.name: unminified-css
result.description: Minify CSS
result.helpText: Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes.[Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/MinifyResources).

result.name: unminified-javascript
result.description: Minify JavaScript
result.helpText: Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time.[Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/MinifyResources).

result.name: unused-css-rules
result.description: Unused CSS rules
result.helpText: Remove unused rules from stylesheets to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/OptimizeCSSDelivery)

result.name: uses-optimized-images
result.description: Optimize images
result.helpText: Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/optimize-images).

result.name: uses-webp-images
result.description: Serve images in next-gen formats
result.helpText: Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/webp).

result.name: uses-request-compression
result.description: Enable text compression
result.helpText: Text-based responses should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/optimize-encoding-and-transfer).

result.name: time-to-first-byte
result.description: Keep server response times low (TTFB)
result.helpText: Time To First Byte identifies the time at which your server sends a response. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/network-performance/issues).

result.name: redirects
result.description: Avoids page redirects
result.helpText: Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/AvoidRedirects).

result.name: total-byte-weight
result.description: Avoids enormous network payloads
result.helpText: Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/network-payloads).

result.name: uses-long-cache-ttl
result.description: Uses inefficient cache policy on static assets
result.helpText: A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/optimizing-content-efficiency/http-caching#cache-control).

result.name: dom-size
result.description: Avoids an excessive DOM size
result.helpText: Browser engineers recommend pages contain fewer than ~1,500 DOM nodes. The sweet spot is a tree depth < 32 elements and fewer than 60 children/parent element. A large DOM can increase memory usage, cause longer [style calculations](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/reduce-the-scope-and-complexity-of-style-calculations), and produce costly [layout reflows](https://developers.google.com/speed/articles/reflow). [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/rendering/).

result.name: critical-request-chains
result.description: Critical Request Chains
result.helpText: The Critical Request Chains below show you what resources are issued with a high priority. Consider reducing the length of chains, reducing the download size of resources, or deferring the download of unnecessary resources to improve page load. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/critical-request-chains).

result.name: user-timings
result.description: User Timing marks and measures
result.helpText: Consider instrumenting your app with the User Timing API to create custom, real-world measurements of key user experiences. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/user-timing).

result.name: bootup-time
result.description: JavaScript boot-up time
result.helpText: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS. You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this.

result.name: screenshot-thumbnails
result.description: Screenshot Thumbnails
result.helpText: This is what the load of your site looked like.

result.name: mainthread-work-breakdown
result.description: Main thread work breakdown
result.helpText: Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS.You may find delivering smaller JS payloads helps with this.

reportCategories.name: Progressive Web App
reportCategories.description: These checks validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App, as specified by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist).

result.name: service-worker
result.description: Does not register a service worker
result.helpText: The service worker is the technology that enables your app to use many Progressive Web App features, such as offline, add to homescreen, and push notifications. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/registered-service-worker).

result.name: works-offline
result.description: Does not respond with a 200 when offline
result.helpText: If you're building a Progressive Web App, consider using a service worker so that your app can work offline. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/http-200-when-offline).

result.name: without-javascript
result.description: Contains some content when JavaScript is not available
result.helpText: Your app should display some content when JavaScript is disabled, even if it's just a warning to the user that JavaScript is required to use the app. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/no-js).

result.name: is-on-https
result.description: Uses HTTPS
result.helpText: All sites should be protected with HTTPS, even ones that don't handle sensitive data. HTTPS prevents intruders from tampering with or passively listening in on the communications between your app and your users, and is a prerequisite for HTTP/2 and many new web platform APIs. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/https).

result.name: redirects-http
result.description: Does not redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS
result.helpText: If you've already set up HTTPS, make sure that you redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/http-redirects-to-https).

result.name: load-fast-enough-for-pwa
result.description: Page load is fast enough on 3G
result.helpText: A fast page load over a 3G network ensures a good mobile user experience. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/fast-3g).

result.debugString: Failures: No manifest was fetched, Site does not register a service worker, Service worker does not successfully serve the manifest's start_url.

warnings: No usable web app manifest found on page http://127.0.0.1:8887/
failures: Site does not register a service worker
Service worker does not successfully serve the manifest's start_url

result.name: webapp-install-banner
result.description: User will not be prompted to Install the Web App
result.helpText: Browsers can proactively prompt users to add your app to their homescreen, which can lead to higher engagement. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/install-prompt).

result.name: splash-screen
result.description: Is not configured for a custom splash screen
result.helpText: A themed splash screen ensures a high-quality experience when users launch your app from their homescreens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/custom-splash-screen).

result.debugString: Failures: No manifest was fetched, No `<meta name="theme-color">` tag found.
result.name: themed-omnibox
result.description: Address bar does not match brand colors
result.helpText: The browser address bar can be themed to match your site. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/address-bar).

result.name: viewport
result.description: Has a `<meta name="viewport">` tag with `width` or `initial-scale`
result.helpText: Add a viewport meta tag to optimize your app for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/has-viewport-meta-tag).

result.name: content-width
result.description: Content is sized correctly for the viewport
result.helpText: If the width of your app's content doesn't match the width of the viewport, your app might not be optimized for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/content-sized-correctly-for-viewport).

result.name: pwa-cross-browser
result.description: Site works cross-browser
result.helpText: To reach the most number of users, sites should work across every major browser. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist#site-works-cross-browser).

result.name: pwa-page-transitions
result.description: Page transitions don't feel like they block on the network
result.helpText: Transitions should feel snappy as you tap around, even on a slow network, a key to perceived performance. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist#page-transitions-dont-feel-like-they-block-on-the-network).

result.name: pwa-each-page-has-url
result.description: Each page has a URL
result.helpText: Ensure individual pages are deep linkable via the URLs and that URLs are unique for the purpose of shareability on social media. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist#each-page-has-a-url).

reportCategories.name: Accessibility
reportCategories.description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility). Only a subset of accessibility issues can be automatically detected so manual testing is also encouraged.

result.name: accesskeys
result.description: `[accesskey]` values are not unique
result.helpText: Access keys let users quickly focus a part of the page. For proper navigation, each access key must be unique. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/accesskeys?application=lighthouse).

result.name: aria-allowed-attr
result.description: `[aria-*]` attributes match their roles
result.helpText: Each ARIA `role` supports a specific subset of `aria-*` attributes. Mismatching these invalidates the `aria-*` attributes. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-allowed-attr?application=lighthouse).

result.name: aria-required-attr
result.description: `[role]`s do not have all required `[aria-*]` attributes
result.helpText: Some ARIA roles have required attributes that describe the state of the element to screen readers. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-required-attr?application=lighthouse).

result.name: aria-required-children
result.description: Elements with `[role]` that require specific children `[role]`s, are missing.
result.helpText: Some ARIA parent roles must contain specific child roles to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-required-children?application=lighthouse).

result.name: aria-required-parent
result.description: `[role]`s are not contained by their required parent element
result.helpText: Some ARIA child roles must be contained by specific parent roles to properly perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-required-parent?application=lighthouse).

result.name: aria-roles
result.description: `[role]` values are not valid
result.helpText: ARIA roles must have valid values in order to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-roles?application=lighthouse).

result.name: aria-valid-attr-value
result.description: `[aria-*]` attributes have valid values
result.helpText: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid values. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-valid-attr-value?application=lighthouse).

result.name: aria-valid-attr
result.description: `[aria-*]` attributes are valid and not misspelled
result.helpText: Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid names. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/aria-valid-attr?application=lighthouse).

result.name: audio-caption
result.description: `<audio>` elements are missing a `<track>` element with `[kind="captions"]`.
result.helpText: Captions make audio elements usable for deaf or hearing-impaired users, providing critical information such as who is talking, what they're saying, and other non-speech information. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/audio-caption?application=lighthouse).

result.name: button-name
result.description: Buttons have an accessible name
result.helpText: When a button doesn't have an accessible name, screen readers announce it as "button", making it unusable for users who rely on screen readers. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/button-name?application=lighthouse).

result.name: bypass
result.description: The page does not contain a heading, skip link, or landmark region
result.helpText: Adding ways to bypass repetitive content lets keyboard users navigate the page more efficiently. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/bypass?application=lighthouse).

result.name: color-contrast
result.description: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
result.helpText: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/color-contrast?application=lighthouse).

result.name: definition-list
result.description: `<dl>`'s do not contain only properly-ordered `<dt>` and `<dd>` groups, `<script>` or `<template>` elements.
result.helpText: When definition lists are not properly marked up, screen readers may produce confusing or inaccurate output. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/definition-list?application=lighthouse).

result.name: dlitem
result.description: Definition list items are not wrapped in `<dl>` elements
result.helpText: Definition list items (`<dt>` and `<dd>`) must be wrapped in a parent `<dl>` element to ensure that screen readers can properly announce them. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/dlitem?application=lighthouse).

result.name: document-title
result.description: Document has a `<title>` element
result.helpText: Screen reader users use page titles to get an overview of the contents of the page. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/document-title?application=lighthouse).

result.name: duplicate-id
result.description: `[id]` attributes on the page are unique
result.helpText: The value of an id attribute must be unique to prevent other instances from being overlooked by assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/duplicate-id?application=lighthouse).

result.name: frame-title
result.description: `<frame>` or `<iframe>` elements do not have a title
result.helpText: Screen reader users rely on frame titles to describe the contents of frames. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/frame-title?application=lighthouse).

value.description: Ensures every HTML document has a lang attribute
value.help: <html> element must have a lang attribute

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute
target: html

result.name: html-has-lang
result.description: `<html>` element does not have a `[lang]` attribute
result.helpText: If a page doesn't specify a lang attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader. If the page isn't actually in the default language, then the screen reader might not announce the page's text correctly. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/html-lang?application=lighthouse).

items.selector: html

result.name: html-lang-valid
result.description: `<html>` element does not have a valid value for its `[lang]` attribute.
result.helpText: Specifying a valid [BCP 47 language](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-choosing-language-tags#question) helps screen readers announce text properly. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/valid-lang?application=lighthouse).

result.name: image-alt
result.description: Image elements do not have `[alt]` attributes
result.helpText: Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute.[Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/image-alt?application=lighthouse).

result.name: input-image-alt
result.description: `<input type="image">` elements do not have `[alt]` text
result.helpText: When an image is being used as an `<input>` button, providing alternative text can help screen reader users understand the purpose of the button. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/input-image-alt?application=lighthouse).

value.description: Ensures every form element has a label

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty or not visible
  Form element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Form element does not have an explicit <label>
  Element has no title attribute or the title attribute is empty
target: #selectCityToAdd

result.name: label
result.description: Form elements do not have associated labels
result.helpText: Labels ensure that form controls are announced properly by assistive technologies, like screen readers. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/label?application=lighthouse).

items.selector: #selectCityToAdd

result.name: layout-table
result.description: Presentational `<table>` elements do not avoid using `<th>`, `<caption>` or the `[summary]` attribute.
result.helpText: A table being used for layout purposes should not include data elements, such as the th or caption elements or the summary attribute, because this can create a confusing experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/layout-table?application=lighthouse).

result.name: link-name
result.description: Links do not have a discernable name
result.helpText: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/link-name?application=lighthouse).

result.name: list
result.description: Lists do not contain only `<li>` elements and script supporting elements (`<script>` and `<template>`).
result.helpText: Screen readers have a specific way of announcing lists. Ensuring proper list structure aids screen reader output. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/list?application=lighthouse).

result.name: listitem
result.description: List items (`<li>`) are not contained within `<ul>` or `<ol>` parent elements.
result.helpText: Screen readers require list items (`<li>`) to be contained within a parent `<ul>` or `<ol>` to be announced properly. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/listitem?application=lighthouse).

result.name: meta-refresh
result.description: The document uses `<meta http-equiv="refresh">`
result.helpText: Users do not expect a page to refresh automatically, and doing so will move focus back to the top of the page. This may create a frustrating or confusing experience. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/meta-refresh?application=lighthouse).

result.name: meta-viewport
result.description: `[user-scalable="no"]` is not used in the `<meta name="viewport">` element and the `[maximum-scale]` attribute is not less than 5.
result.helpText: Disabling zooming is problematic for users with low vision who rely on screen magnification to properly see the contents of a web page. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/meta-viewport?application=lighthouse).

result.name: object-alt
result.description: `<object>` elements do not have `[alt]` text
result.helpText: Screen readers cannot translate non-text content. Adding alt text to `<object>` elements helps screen readers convey meaning to users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/object-alt?application=lighthouse).

result.name: tabindex
result.description: Some elements have a `[tabindex]` value greater than 0
result.helpText: A value greater than 0 implies an explicit navigation ordering. Although technically valid, this often creates frustrating experiences for users who rely on assistive technologies. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/tabindex?application=lighthouse).

result.name: td-headers-attr
result.description: Cells in a `<table>` element that use the `[headers]` attribute refers to other cells of that same table.
result.helpText: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring `<td>` cells using the `[headers]` attribute only refer to other cells in the same table may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/td-headers-attr?application=lighthouse).

result.name: th-has-data-cells
result.description: `<th>` elements and elements with `[role="columnheader"/"rowheader"]` do not have data cells they describe.
result.helpText: Screen readers have features to make navigating tables easier. Ensuring table headers always refer to some set of cells may improve the experience for screen reader users. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/th-has-data-cells?application=lighthouse).

result.name: valid-lang
result.description: `[lang]` attributes do not have a valid value
result.helpText: Specifying a valid [BCP 47 language](https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-choosing-language-tags#question) on elements helps ensure that text is pronounced correctly by a screen reader. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/valid-lang?application=lighthouse).

result.name: video-caption
result.description: `<video>` elements do not contain a `<track>` element with `[kind="captions"]`.
result.helpText: When a video provides a caption it is easier for deaf and hearing impaired users to access its information. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/video-caption?application=lighthouse).

result.name: video-description
result.description: `<video>` elements do not contain a `<track>` element with `[kind="description"]`.
result.helpText: Audio descriptions provide relevant information for videos that dialogue cannot, such as facial expressions and scenes. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/video-description?application=lighthouse).

result.name: logical-tab-order
result.description: The page has a logical tab order
result.helpText: Tabbing through the page follows the visual layout. Users cannot focus elements that are offscreen. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#start_with_the_keyboard).

result.name: focusable-controls
result.description: Interactive controls are keyboard focusable
result.helpText: Custom interactive controls are keyboard focusable and display a focus indicator. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#start_with_the_keyboard).

result.name: managed-focus
result.description: The user's focus is directed to new content added to the page
result.helpText: If new content, such as a dialog, is added to the page, the user's focus is directed to it. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#start_with_the_keyboard).

result.name: focus-traps
result.description: User focus is not accidentally trapped in a region
result.helpText: A user can tab into and out of any control or region without accidentally trapping their focus. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#start_with_the_keyboard).

result.name: custom-controls-labels
result.description: Custom controls have associated labels
result.helpText: Custom interactive controls have associated labels, provided by aria-label or aria-labelledby. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#try_it_with_a_screen_reader).

result.name: custom-controls-roles
result.description: Custom controls have ARIA roles
result.helpText: Custom interactive controls have appropriate ARIA roles. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#try_it_with_a_screen_reader).

result.name: visual-order-follows-dom
result.description: Visual order on the page follows DOM order
result.helpText: DOM order matches the visual order, improving navigation for assistive technology. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#try_it_with_a_screen_reader).

result.name: offscreen-content-hidden
result.description: Offscreen content is hidden from assistive technology
result.helpText: Offscreen content is hidden with display: none or aria-hidden=true. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#try_it_with_a_screen_reader).

result.name: heading-levels
result.description: Headings don't skip levels
result.helpText: Headings are used to create an outline for the page and heading levels are not skipped. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#take_advantage_of_headings_and_landmarks).

result.name: use-landmarks
result.description: HTML5 landmark elements are used to improve navigation
result.helpText: Landmark elements (<main>, <nav>, etc.) are used to improve the keyboard navigation of the page for assistive technology. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review#take_advantage_of_headings_and_landmarks).

reportCategories.name: Best Practices
reportCategories.description: We've compiled some recommendations for modernizing your web app and avoiding performance pitfalls.

result.name: appcache-manifest
result.description: Avoids Application Cache
result.helpText: Application Cache is deprecated. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/appcache).

result.name: no-websql
result.description: Avoids WebSQL DB
result.helpText: Web SQL is deprecated. Consider using IndexedDB instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/web-sql).

result.name: is-on-https
result.description: Uses HTTPS
result.helpText: All sites should be protected with HTTPS, even ones that don't handle sensitive data. HTTPS prevents intruders from tampering with or passively listening in on the communications between your app and your users, and is a prerequisite for HTTP/2 and many new web platform APIs. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/https).

result.displayValue: 8 requests were not handled over HTTP/2
result.name: uses-http2
result.description: Does not use HTTP/2 for all of its resources
result.helpText: HTTP/2 offers many benefits over HTTP/1.1, including binary headers, multiplexing, and server push. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/http2).

result.name: uses-passive-event-listeners
result.description: Uses passive listeners to improve scrolling performance
result.helpText: Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/passive-event-listeners).

result.name: no-mutation-events
result.description: Avoids Mutation Events in its own scripts
result.helpText: Mutation Events are deprecated and harm performance. Consider using Mutation Observers instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/mutation-events).

result.name: no-document-write
result.description: Avoids `document.write()`
result.helpText: For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/document-write).

result.name: external-anchors-use-rel-noopener
result.description: Opens external anchors using `rel="noopener"`
result.helpText: Open new tabs using `rel="noopener"` to improve performance and prevent security vulnerabilities. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/noopener).

result.name: geolocation-on-start
result.description: Avoids requesting the geolocation permission on page load
result.helpText: Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request their location without context. Consider tying the request to user gestures instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/geolocation-on-load).

result.name: no-vulnerable-libraries
result.description: Avoids front-end JavaScript libraries with known security vulnerabilities
result.helpText: Some third-party scripts may contain known security vulnerabilities  that are easily identified and exploited by attackers.

result.name: notification-on-start
result.description: Avoids requesting the notification permission on page load
result.helpText: Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request to send notifications without context. Consider tying the request to user gestures instead. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/notifications-on-load).

result.name: deprecations
result.description: Avoids deprecated APIs
result.helpText: Deprecated APIs will eventually be removed from the browser. [Learn more](https://www.chromestatus.com/features#deprecated).

result.name: manifest-short-name-length
result.description: Manifest's `short_name` will be truncated when displayed on homescreen
result.helpText: Make your app's `short_name` fewer than 12 characters to ensure that it's not truncated on homescreens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/manifest-short_name-is-not-truncated).

result.name: password-inputs-can-be-pasted-into
result.description: Allows users to paste into password fields
result.helpText: Preventing password pasting undermines good security policy. [Learn more](https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/blog-post/let-them-paste-passwords)

header.text: Password inputs that prevent pasting into

result.name: errors-in-console
result.description: No browser errors logged to the console
result.helpText: Errors logged to the console indicate unresolved problems. They can come from network request failures and other browser concerns.

result.name: image-aspect-ratio
result.description: Displays images with correct aspect ratio
result.helpText: Image display dimensions should match natural aspect ratio.

reportCategories.name: SEO
reportCategories.description: These checks ensure that your page is optimized for search engine results ranking. There are additional factors Lighthouse does not check that may affect your search ranking. [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35769).

result.name: viewport
result.description: Has a `<meta name="viewport">` tag with `width` or `initial-scale`
result.helpText: Add a viewport meta tag to optimize your app for mobile screens. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/has-viewport-meta-tag).

result.name: document-title
result.description: Document has a `<title>` element
result.helpText: Screen reader users use page titles to get an overview of the contents of the page. [Learn more](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/2.2/document-title?application=lighthouse).

result.name: meta-description
result.description: Document does not have a meta description
result.helpText: Meta descriptions may be included in search results to concisely summarize page content. [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35624?hl=en#1).

result.name: http-status-code
result.description: Page has successful HTTP status code
result.helpText: Pages with unsuccessful HTTP status codes may not be indexed properly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/successful-http-code).

result.name: link-text
result.description: Links have descriptive text
result.helpText: Descriptive link text helps search engines understand your content. [Learn more](https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2008/10/importance-of-link-architecture.html).

result.name: is-crawlable
result.description: Page isn’t blocked from indexing
result.helpText: The "Robots" directives tell crawlers how your content should be indexed. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/search/reference/robots_meta_tag).

result.name: hreflang
result.description: Document has a valid `hreflang`
result.helpText: hreflang allows crawlers to discover alternate translations of the page content. [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/189077).

result.name: canonical
result.description: Document does not have a valid `rel=canonical`
result.helpText: Canonical links suggest which URL to show in search results. Read more in [Use canonical URLs](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/139066).

result.name: font-size
result.description: Document doesn't use legible font sizes
result.helpText: Font sizes less than 16px are too small to be legible and require mobile visitors to “pinch to zoom” in order to read. Strive to have >75% of page text ≥16px. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/speed/docs/insights/UseLegibleFontSizes).

result.name: plugins
result.description: Document avoids plugins
result.helpText: Most mobile devices do not support plugins, and many desktop browsers restrict them.

result.name: mobile-friendly
result.description: Page is mobile friendly
result.helpText: Take the [Mobile-Friendly Test](https://search.google.com/test/mobile-friendly) to see how easily a visitor can use your page on a mobile device. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/search/mobile-sites/).

result.name: structured-data
result.description: Structured data is valid
result.helpText: Run the [Structured Data Testing Tool](https://search.google.com/structured-data/testing-tool/) and the [Structured Data Linter](http://linter.structured-data.org/) to validate structured data. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/search/docs/guides/mark-up-content).

perf-metric.title: Metrics
perf-metric.description: These metrics encapsulate your web app's performance across a number of dimensions.

perf-hint.title: Opportunities
perf-hint.description: These are opportunities to speed up your application by optimizing the following resources.

perf-info.title: Diagnostics
perf-info.description: More information about the performance of your application.

a11y-color-contrast.title: Color Contrast Is Satisfactory
a11y-color-contrast.description: These are opportunities to improve the legibility of your content.

a11y-describe-contents.title: Elements Describe Contents Well
a11y-describe-contents.description: These are opportunities to make your content easier to understand for a user of assistive technology, like a screen reader.

a11y-well-structured.title: Elements Are Well Structured
a11y-well-structured.description: These are opportunities to make sure your HTML is appropriately structured.

a11y-aria.title: ARIA Attributes Follow Best Practices
a11y-aria.description: These are opportunities to improve the usage of ARIA in your application which may enhance the experience for users of assistive technology, like a screen reader.

a11y-correct-attributes.title: Elements Use Attributes Correctly
a11y-correct-attributes.description: These are opportunities to improve the configuration of your HTML elements.

a11y-element-names.title: Elements Have Discernable Names
a11y-element-names.description: These are opportunities to improve the semantics of the controls in your application. This may enhance the experience for users of assistive technology, like a screen reader.

a11y-language.title: Page Specifies Valid Language
a11y-language.description: These are opportunities to improve the interpretation of your content by users in different locales.

a11y-meta.title: Meta Tags Used Properly
a11y-meta.description: These are opportunities to improve the user experience of your site.

manual-a11y-checks.title: Additional items to manually check
manual-a11y-checks.description: These items address areas which an automated testing tool cannot cover. Learn more in our guide on [conducting an accessibility review](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review).

manual-pwa-checks.title: Additional items to manually check
manual-pwa-checks.description: These checks are required by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist) but are not automatically checked by Lighthouse. They do not affect your score but it's important that you verify them manually.

seo-mobile.title: Mobile Friendly
seo-mobile.description: Make sure your pages are mobile friendly so users don’t have to pinch or zoom in order to read the content pages. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/search/mobile-sites/).

seo-content.title: Content Best Practices
seo-content.description: Format your HTML in a way that enables crawlers to better understand your app’s content.

seo-crawl.title: Crawling and Indexing
seo-crawl.description: To appear in search results, crawlers need access to your app.

manual-seo-checks.title: Additional items to manually check
manual-seo-checks.description: Run these additional validators on your site to check additional SEO best practices.
